title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 09 October 2014 - XWiki
content:
<Denis> has joined #xwiki  
04:06 <Denis> has quit  
05:01 <D-Spair> has quit  
07:21 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:23 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:59 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:16 <silverdrop> has joined #xwiki  
08:20 <silverdrop> has quit  
08:22 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
08:37 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
08:40 <silverdr1p> has joined #xwiki  
08:46 <vmassol> good moorning  
08:46 <vmassol> BFD today! :)  
08:46 <vmassol> and we still need a RM for 6.3M1 ;)  
08:56 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:13 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
09:18 <vmassol> mflorea: good morning, please let me know what you think of http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11174?focusedCommentId=82959&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-82959  
09:19 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
09:19 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
09:22 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:26 <mflorea> vmassol: looks good to me  
09:27 <vmassol> ok thanks, now that's a lot to implement ;)  
09:27 <mflorea> indeed  
09:28 <mflorea> has quit  
09:28 <vmassol> FTR mflorea the issue is not pretty important due to the FM :)  
09:29 <vmassol> since you have automatic preview on office files now when you add them...  
09:29 <vmassol> s/not/now  
09:29 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:29 <vmassol> FTR mflorea the issue is now pretty important due to the FM  
09:29 <vmassol> since you have automatic preview on office files now when you add them...  
09:30 <mflorea> I can disable automatic preview :P  
09:30 <tmortagne> vmassol: commented  
09:30 <vmassol> mflorea: yes I thought about this  
09:30 <vmassol> thanks tmortagne  
09:30 <vmassol> it's probably a good idea to not have it on by default till we have a solution that works fine  
09:31 <vmassol> btw mflorea did you check that an office server is started before doing the preview?  
09:31 <vmassol> (I still get a NPE if it's not started, no check is done apparently)  
09:31 <vmassol> (haven't looked into this one)  
09:32 <tmortagne> is it BFD today ?  
09:32 <mflorea> https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-filemanager/blob/master/ui/src/main/resources/FileManagerCode/FileSheet.xml#L168  
09:32 <mflorea> I do check  
09:32 <tmortagne> hmm I have to restart, back in 5 min  
09:32 <tmortagne> has quit  
09:33 <mflorea> vmassol: the office macro doesn't do the check. This needs to be fixed  
09:33 <vmassol> yep  
09:33 <vmassol> so the FM will fail  
09:33 <vmassol> sorry  
09:33 <vmassol> you do check  
09:33 <vmassol> (misread)  
09:34 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:41 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
09:43 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: don't forget to update http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki622/languages.png too if you can ;)  
09:43 <gdelhumeau> indeed  
09:56 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
09:59 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
10:02 <vmassol> mflorea: for the FM you use a REST service?  
10:02 <mflorea> no, wiki page  
10:02 <vmassol> ok, so that it can get installed with EM ;)  
10:02 <mflorea> yep  
10:05 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:09 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <AFKGeek> has joined #xwiki  
10:28 <cjd> has quit  
10:33 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: wdyt of the new text I added in the RN?  
10:33 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
10:35 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: your text is very good  
10:35 <vmassol> ok good  
10:35 <gdelhumeau> I often forget that we are first a community, so we can explain more things about the interns  
10:35 <gdelhumeau> \*internals  
10:36 <gdelhumeau> and also it explain why it is still changing  
10:36 <gdelhumeau> good  
10:36 <vmassol> :)  
10:42 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: so at the end, should I dupplicate what I have added to the Release Notes for 6.2.2 to the RN for 6.3M1?  
10:45 <vmassol> we don't have a formal position on position but I think we should since users may not have gone through 6.2.2 when they will install 6.3 final  
10:45 <vmassol> at worse it just duplicates content  
10:45 <vmassol> but it's better for the end users  
10:45 <gdelhumeau> ok  
10:45 <vmassol> you can just put "since 6.2" in the RN for 6.3M1  
10:45 <vmassol> (I think that's what is there now)  
10:46 <vmassol> in other words, it shouldn't be "since 6.2.2"  
10:46 <gdelhumeau> I dupplicate your text too then.  
10:46 <vmassol> yep just checked  
10:46 <vmassol> "New and Noteworthy (since XWiki 6.2)"  
10:46 <gdelhumeau> .  
10:46 <vmassol> so it's good to duplicate  
10:47 <vmassol> till we have that famous Release Notes Application I've been dreaming of doing ;)  
10:48 <vmassol> I can't find the thread where I talked about it anymore  
10:49 <vmassol> one mention here: http://markmail.org/message/bg4xz3vlho2u7bcc  
10:50 <tmortagne> vmassol: I don't think you dedicated a thread to it  
10:50 <vmassol> yep I didn't  
10:50 <vmassol> another mention http://markmail.org/message/tu4vkjb2eqkvkyka  
10:50 <vmassol> apparently I had even stated work on it ;)  
11:22 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
11:36 <Denis1> has quit  
11:43 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
11:44 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
12:22 <mflorea> guys, how can I prevent the functional tests from closing my xwiki instance?  
12:24 <mflorea> found, nvm  
13:00 <AFKGeek> has quit  
13:02 <msmeria> has quit  
13:06 <Denis1> has quit  
13:15 <DarkKnightCZ> what would be the best way to reuse XWiki.SuggestSolrService to obtain pages with tags on search?  (Administration -> Search Suggest)  
13:15 <Lyes> has quit  
13:18 <DarkKnightCZ> fq=type:DOCUMENT fq=class:XWiki.TagClass qf=object.XWiki.TagClass  maybe?  
13:36 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: What happened to the comments docextra tab and why is it no longer using the comments.css classes? Annotations was using the "commenttool" and "commentreply" classes and now docextra is using other classes and comments.css is not even used anymore. This is the issue I am looking at now http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11032  
13:36 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
13:37 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
13:38 <Enygma`> the reply button is on the left of the annotation edit button, but the icon is no longer displayed for it, so the button is "invisible"  
13:39 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: also, using ?skin=colibri, the Comments pane is a mess: No label for the Comments docextra tab and no buttons are displayed for individual comments  
14:12 <AFKGeek> has joined #xwiki  
14:21 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
14:23 <gdelhumeau> try ?skin=colibri&&colorTheme=ColorThemes.Azure  
14:23 <gdelhumeau> for the last issue you talked about  
14:25 <gdelhumeau> now let me look at the comment pane  
14:30 <gdelhumeau> indeed, commentsinline.vm has ben changed to use the bootstrap styles  
14:30 <gdelhumeau> and the structure is not exactly the same too  
14:34 <Enygma`> probably for the annotations case, to preserve consistency with it's current icons, best would be to create a new css class for the reply button and use the silk icon that we used before  
14:36 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
14:37 <gdelhumeau> there is .annotationTools .edit{  
14:37 <gdelhumeau> background-image:url(/xwiki/resources/icons/silk/pencil.png)  
14:37 <gdelhumeau> }  
14:38 <gdelhumeau> in AnnotationCode.Style  
14:38 <gdelhumeau> But I see anything about the reply  
14:39 <Enygma`> because it was reusing the class from the comments tab  
14:39 <Enygma`> to look consistent  
14:39 <Enygma`> now with the change, we can forget about that  
14:40 <gdelhumeau> and the comment style were in comments.css or in style.css ?  
14:40 <gdelhumeau> because comments.css is still enabled  
14:40 <gdelhumeau> maybe the path of the rule as been changed tought  
14:42 <gdelhumeau> I think you can take .commentreply a {  
14:42 <gdelhumeau> } from comments.css and adapt it to AnnotationCode.Style  
14:43 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
14:43 <D-Spair> has joined #xwiki  
14:46 <gdelhumeau> thx Denis1  
14:47 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
14:51 <cjd> makes sense  
17:14 <AFKGeek> has quit  
17:33 <Enygma`> tmortagne: do you think it`s safe to close http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9498 as a duplicate of http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11107 ? Or maybe a duplicate of http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10935? WDYT?  
17:33 <vmassol> Enygma`:  
17:33 <vmassol> you need to test it  
17:34 <Enygma`> I was going to get the latest snapshot  
17:34 <Enygma`> I`ve asked Caty to test on a 1 day old snapshot and she got just 1 lucene index thread exception, not a huge trace  
17:34 <tmortagne> Enygma`: not as suplicate of XWIKI-10935 for sure  
17:34 <Enygma`> testing myself  
17:34 <tmortagne> it's very localization oriented  
17:34 <Enygma`> tmortagne: that was about doc bundles  
17:34 <Enygma`> yeah  
17:35 <Enygma`> and vincent`s XWIKI-11107 is about the JVM closing AFAIU...  
17:35 <Enygma`> let me test though  
17:36 <vmassol> yes my fix shouldn't fix 10935  
17:36 <vmassol> it just prevents hibernate being stopped too early  
17:37 <vmassol> closing a wiki shouldn't stop the hibernate system  
17:37 <vmassol> (hibernate system = hibernate session factory)  
17:37 <Enygma`> I wonder if tmortagne's fix silenced the logs for this problem as well, or it`s completely unrelated  
17:38 <tmortagne> Enygma`: I don't understand what you mean  
17:39 <Enygma`> nah, I`d better stop assuming and just test it :)  
17:45 <Enygma`> yeah, it still reproduces  
17:45 <Enygma`> though I first got, just like Caty, just 1 lucene index exception  
17:45 <Enygma`> after 10-20 seconds the Solr index thread started spitting the rest  
17:46 <vmassol> nothings tells it to stop indexing and clear his queue for this wiki I guess  
17:47 <Enygma`> yep  
17:47 <Enygma`> moving on  
17:49 <tmortagne> what is missing is a WikiDeletingEvent actually  
17:50 <tmortagne> even if it was doing cleanup based on WikiDeletedEvent it would still be too late  
17:50 <tmortagne> the other possibility is to check if the wiki exist each time we need to access a document from SOLR and just skip it if it does not  
17:51 <tmortagne> but it's not very clean
